Simulated substance use treatment data

substance_use.Rd

A dataset containing longitudinal observations of clients receiving treatment for substance use disorders. This simulated dataset reflects realistic patterns of treatment engagement, substance use, quality of life measures, and medication treatment patterns for clients with alcohol or opioid use disorders.

Usage

substance_use

Format

A tibble with 15,779 rows and 12 variables:

client_id

Character. Unique identifier for each client

visit_date

Date. Date of treatment visit

substance_use_past_week

Numeric. Number of days (0-7) client used substances in past week

quality_of_life_score

Numeric. Self-reported quality of life score (0-100)

medication_dose_mg

Numeric. Medication dose in milligrams, if applicable

medication_name

Character. Name of medication prescribed, if applicable

Age

Integer. Client age in years

Gender

Factor with levels: Male, Female, Non-Binary

Race

Factor with 8 levels including White, Hispanic, Black, etc.

primary_substance

Factor with levels: Alcohol, Opioids

baseline_housing

Factor with levels: Stable, Temporary, Unstable, Unhoused

trauma_history

Logical. Whether client has reported history of trauma

Source

Simulated data created using the wakefield package with parameters designed to reflect realistic patterns observed in substance use treatment programs.

Details

The data simulates different patterns of treatment engagement including: regular attendance, episodic treatment with gaps, and sporadic attendance. Treatment outcomes vary with engagement patterns, which are distributed across three types: improving, declining, and fluctuating.

Medication information reflects evidence-based medications for opioid use disorder (buprenorphine, methadone, naltrexone) and alcohol use disorder (naltrexone, acamprosate, disulfiram) with realistic dosing patterns.

Examples

summary(substance_use)
#>   client_id           visit_date         substance_use_past_week
#>  Length:15779       Min.   :2020-01-01   Min.   :0.00           
#>  Class :character   1st Qu.:2020-02-26   1st Qu.:1.00           
#>  Mode  :character   Median :2020-05-24   Median :2.00           
#>                     Mean   :2020-10-17   Mean   :2.31           
#>                     3rd Qu.:2020-09-19   3rd Qu.:3.00           
#>                     Max.   :2024-12-31   Max.   :7.00           
#>                                                                 
#>  quality_of_life_score medication_dose_mg medication_name         Age      
#>  Min.   :13.0          Min.   :   0       Length:15779       Min.   :18.0  
#>  1st Qu.:35.0          1st Qu.:   4       Class :character   1st Qu.:29.0  
#>  Median :40.0          Median :  12       Mode  :character   Median :42.0  
#>  Mean   :40.5          Mean   : 176                          Mean   :41.6  
#>  3rd Qu.:46.0          3rd Qu.:  50                          3rd Qu.:53.0  
#>  Max.   :70.0          Max.   :1998                          Max.   :65.0  
#>                                                                            
#>     Gender            Race      primary_substance  baseline_housing

#>  Female:5209   Hispanic :2480   Opioids:11038     Temporary:2604
